meanings.definition: The act of arriving or entering.
meanings.sent1: His comings were always greeted with excitement by his friends.
meanings.sent2: The comings and goings of the students made the hallway busy.
meanings.sent3: The comings of the new puppy brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent4: The comings of spring signaled the end of winter's grip.
meanings.sent5: The comings of the mail carrier were eagerly awaited each day.

meanings.definition: The act of happening or occurring.
meanings.sent1: The comings of unexpected guests can be a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent2: The comings of storms in the summer are common in this region.
meanings.sent3: The comings of new ideas can lead to exciting discoveries.
meanings.sent4: The comings of change are inevitable in life.
meanings.sent5: The comings of holidays bring joy and celebration.

meanings.definition: The act of approaching or drawing near.
meanings.sent1: The comings of winter could be felt in the chill of the air.
meanings.sent2: The comings of the train could be heard in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The comings of the deadline made everyone work harder.
meanings.sent4: The comings of the finish line motivated the runners to push harder.
meanings.sent5: The comings of the weekend were eagerly anticipated by the workers.
